author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Sean Combs' ex-girlfriend 'Jane' testifies about violent brawls

author: Ali McCadden, CNBC
description: The cost of some baby gear has risen in recent weeks due to President Donald Trump’s tariff policies, according to a new congressional report
title: Prices for common baby items are rising due to Trump's tariffs, congressional analysis says

author: Hayley Cuccinello, CNBC
description: Nvidia’s soaring stock price has supercharged CEO Jensen Huang’s fortunes — as well as his charitable giving
title: Jensen Huang's charitable foundation balloons on Nvidia stock gains

author: Kevin Breuninger, CNBC
description: Former Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen predicts President Donald Trump’s tariffs will cause prices to rise and average household income to fall, despite a slowing trend in the U.S. inflation rate.“I would expect inflation, on a year-over-year basis of this year, to shoot up to at least 3%, or slightly over, because of the tariffs,” Yellen said Thursday on CNBC’s “Money Movers.”The Biden-era Cabinet secretary made that prediction even as she noted that when it comes to Trump’s tarif
title: Yellen expects Trump's tariffs will hike inflation to 3% year over year

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: Despite widespread fears to the contrary, President Donald Trump’s tariffs have yet to show up in any of the traditional data points measuring inflation
title: Here are the three reasons tariffs have yet to drive inflation higher

author: Lauren Sausser | KFF Health News
description: Health insurers issue millions of prior authorization denials every year, leaving many patients stuck in a convoluted appeals process.
title: ‘A big mess’: With prior authorizations and insurance denials, some patients run out of time

author: The Politics Desk
description: The episode between Sen. Alex Padilla and the Department of Homeland Security further escalates the immigration showdown between Trump and the Democrats.
title: A new front opens in the immigration battle: From the Politics Desk

author: Tyler Kingkade
description: A federal judge last week approved the settlement against Trinity Teen Solutions in Wyoming, ending four years of litigation over allegations of forced labor.
title: Lawsuit accusing ranch of forcing teens to do hard labor settles for $2.3 million

author: Kevin Collier
description: A cyberattack on a primary organic food distributor has led to empty shelves at Whole Foods stores across the country
title: Whole Foods struggles with shortages after cyberattack hits natural foods distributor

author: Joe Murphy
description: Bacon prices are going up, and experts say these prices may not be coming down, driven by a confluence of economic factors.
title: As egg prices decline, bacon sizzles

author: Sahil Kapur
description: The Republican-led House voted 214-212 on Thursday to pass a proposal from President Donald Trump to cancel $9.4 billion in previously approved federal funding
title: House Republicans vote to claw back $9.4 billion in funding for foreign aid, NPR and PBS

author: Dan De Luce
description: Russia is exploiting and amplifying online conspiracy theories about the immigration protests in Los Angeles, experts say.
title: Russia is amplifying conspiracy theories about the L.A. protests

author: The Associated Press
description: There are high expectations everywhere at the U.S. Open as golfers are set to face an Oakmont course reputed to be the toughest in the land.
title: U.S. Open underway with high expectations for Scheffler and a tough test for all

author: Jean Lee
description: Kseniia Petrova, a Harvard scientist who was arrested last month on a federal smuggling charge, was released Wednesday from Immigration and Customs Enforcement custody following a detention hearing in Boston.
title: Harvard researcher is released from federal custody following accusations of smuggling frog embryos

author: Evan Bush
description: Canadian wildfire smoke is triggering air quality alerts across the U.S.
title: Smoke from Canadian wildfires hits air quality across U.S. Midwest and Northeast

description: Sen. Alex Padilla, D-Calif., could be heard saying, “I have a question for the secretary,” as he was forcibly removed from Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s press conference in Los Angeles. Noem was addressing the ongoing immigration protests.
title: Watch: Sen. Alex Padilla forcibly removed from Noem press conference

description: The plane crashed into an area with multiple buildings. Several hospitals are near the crash site.
title: Map: Location of the Air India crash

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: Sen. Alex Padilla, D-Calif., was forcibly removed from a news conference in Los Angeles on Thursday and detained after trying to question Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem."I am Sen.
title: Sen. Alex Padilla is forcibly removed from DHS Secretary Kristi Noem's news conference

description: Govs. Kathy Hochul of New York, JB Pritzker of Illinois and Tim Walz of Minnesota appeared before the House Oversight Committee amid protests around the country over ICE raids.

description: Watch live coverage as U.S. Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem holds a press conference in Los Angeles.

author: Nidhi Sharma
description: President Donald Trump signed three resolutions on Thursday barring California from mandating electric vehicle sales and setting tailpipe emissions standards designed to galvanize the transition away from combustion engines.
title: Trump signs resolutions blocking California’s pro-EV rules

author: Viola Flowers
description: At least four people are dead and three are missing in San Antonio, Texas, after floodwaters swept 13 vehicles away early Thursday morning.
title: 13 vehicles swept away in San Antonio flooding, leaving 4 dead and 3 missing

author: Anna Kaplan, TODAY
description: Months after posting photos of what appeared to be an engagement ring, Dua Lipa confirmed her engagement to actor Callum Turner.“Yeah, we’re engaged,” Lipa said in an interview with British Vogue published on June 12.
title: Dua Lipa confirms engagement to Callum Turner

description: A New York state judge declared a mistrial in the final rape charge against Harvey Weinstein after a jury foreman refused to deliberate. Prosecutors vowed to try Weinstein again on the third-degree rape charge on which the jury had been deadlocked.
title: Judge declares a mistrial on one count in Harvey Weinstein retrial

author: Emily Berk
description: The retrial of Harvey Weinstein ended abruptly Thursday when the jury foreman refused to join the deliberations on the remaining rape charge against the disgraced movie mogul
title: Harvey Weinstein trial ends in mistrial on final rape charge after jury foreman refuses to deliberate

author: Viola Flowers
description: Houston Texans safety Jimmie Ward was arrested on Thursday morning on a third-degree felony assault charge, according to Montgomery County Jail records
title: Houston Texans safety Jimmie Ward arrested on felony assault charge

author: Alexander Smith
description: Ballymena, Northern Ireland, has endured a third night of rioting by racist thugs targeting immigrants, with homes, stores and cars destroyed.
title: Northern Ireland town is engulfed in racist riots for a third day

description: Abbott made the announcement amid anti-ICE protests in Texas and across the country.
title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott deploys over 5,000 National Guard soldiers to the state

author: Viola Flowers
description: A man who posed as a flight attendant for four different airlines scammed 120 free flights over the course of years, the U.S.
title: Man convicted of posing as flight attendant to score over 120 free flights

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court revived a lawsuit against the FBI in a damages claim arising from an incident in which agents raided the wrong house in Atlanta.
title: Supreme Court revives FBI 'wrong house' raid lawsuit

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: The 11-year-old girl's symptoms have worsened since the mixed-immigration status family was deported to Mexico, the mother told NBC News.
title: Deported family of 11-year-old U.S. citizen  recovering from rare brain tumor requests humanitarian parole

author: Kevin Collier
description: A new report says 17 VPN apps that are available on Google and Apple's App Stores have undisclosed ties to China.
title: Your VPN could be giving your browsing data to China, watchdog says

author: Hallie Jackson
description: Despite price pressures from tariffs and an extended sales slump, Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol said he is optimistic the company is on the comeback trail.“I’m genuinely excited about the opportunity for our company,” Niccol told NBC News’ Hallie Jackson in an interview
title: Starbucks' CEO looks to snap sales slump with prices and protein

author: MacKenzie Sigalos, CNBC
description: Shaquille O’Neal has agreed to pay $1.8 million to settle claims that he misled investors by promoting the now-bankrupt crypto exchange FTX
title: Shaquille O'Neal to pay $1.8 million to settle FTX investor lawsuit

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A 9-year-old girl snorkeling off Boca Grande, Florida, was attacked by a shark, leaving her with severe injuries.
title: 9-year-old girl survives shark attack in Florida

description: Watch live coverage as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth testifies at a House Armed Services Committee hearing on the 2026 budget.

description: Early in the second quarter of Game 3 of the NBA Finals, the Indiana Pacers’ home crowd was in a bit of a lull.
title: The smallest player on the floor had one of the biggest impacts in Game 3 of NBA Finals

description: After days of demonstrations in Los Angeles, protests are growing nationwide in opposition to President Donald Trump’s ongoing immigration raids. At the Kennedy Center, the president again defended his decision to call in the National Guard and Marines to L.A. despite objections from local officials. “If we weren't there, we didn't bring in the national and the Marines, then you would probably have a city that was burning to the ground,” he says. NBC’s Liz Kreutz reports for TODAY.
title: Protests Over ICE Raids Spread to More Cities Across US

author: The Associated Press
description: More than 460 laid-off employees at the nation’s top public health agency received notices Wednesday that they are being reinstated, according to a union representing the workers.
title: Hundreds of laid-off CDC employees are being reinstated

author: The Associated Press
description: McALESTER, Okla. — Oklahoma prepared to execute a man Thursday whose transfer to state custody was expedited by the Trump administration
title: Oklahoma prepares to execute a man transferred from federal custody by Trump officials

author: The Associated Press
description: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. — Police in South Carolina engaged in a not-so-hot pursuit as they chased a tractor excavator down a main highway for more than an hour at the speed an average adult walks
title: Not-so-hot pursuit of burglary suspect sees police cars chase tractor excavator at walking pace

description: The Republican-led bill would claw back $9.4 billion in spending and includes cuts to foreign aid, NPR and PBS.
title: House to vote on legislation to codify DOGE cuts

author: Rudy Chinchilla
description: Tear gas was fired into a crowd of protesters in Las Vegas.
title: Tear gas, flags and legal battles as ICE protests continue nationwide

description: Sources tell NBC News that Israel is considering taking military action against Iran in the coming days. Officials in Washington are now putting Americans in the region on alert. NBC’s Matt Bradley reports for TODAY.
title: Israel Considers Military Action Against Iran, Sources Say

description: The defense will question 'Jane' about her relationship with Combs in an attempt to recast her allegations of forced sex, physical violence and abuse.
title: Sean Combs' ex-girlfriend 'Jane' returns to the stand for cross-examination

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Donald Trump’s rhetoric about L.A. protestors stands in contrast to his reaction on Jan.
title: Plane crashes near Indian airport and judge rules on Mahmoud Khalil detainment: Morning Rundown

description: Air India flight 171 from Ahmedabad, India, to London Gatwick Airport crashed moments after takeoff. The airline says 242 people were onboard, including two pilots and 10 crew members. This is the first crash for a Boeing 787 Dreamliner. NBC’s Tom Costello reports for TODAY.
title: Air India Flight Carrying 242 People Crashes After Takeoff

author: Evie Steele
description: Renting is taking off in the suburbs as homeownership remains out of reach for many would-be buyers
title: White picket rents: Tenants are flooding the suburbs where they can't afford to buy

description: An Air India flight crashed shortly after take-off in Ahmedabad, India. The plane was bound for London Gatwick airport and was carrying 242 passengers and crew, according to a statement from Air India.
title: Air India flight crashes shortly after take-off in Ahmedabad, India

author: Reuters
description: Australia’s defense minister said he was confident that the AUKUS submarine pact with the United States and Britain would proceed, and that his government would work closely with the U.S. while the Trump administration conducted a formal review.
title: Australia confident U.S. will proceed with AUKUS submarine deal after review

author: Jennifer Jett
description: An Air India plane crashed Thursday at an airport in the western Indian city of Ahmedabad.
title: Plane crash with 242 people on board near Indian airport appears to leave no survivors

author: Jennifer Jett
description: An Air India plane crashed Thursday at an airport in the western Indian city of Ahmedabad.
title: Plane crashes near major Indian airport

author: Allan Smith
description: The legislation from Sen. Cynthia Lummis seeks to address the legal gray area of exactly who is liable when AI is used in a sensitive medical, legal or financial situation.
title: New GOP bill would protect AI companies from lawsuits if they offer transparency

author: Tyler Kingkade
description: Researchers hoping to defend their work against the Trump administration are learning to communicate about what they do — and why it matters.
title: Researchers have a radical plan to thwart Trump's war on science: Talking to people

author: Rich Schapiro
description: Unrest in L.A. follows a recent pattern: protests remain mostly peaceful during the day, but at night agitators engage in fiery clashes with police.
title: Some far-left groups have encouraged peaceful protests to turn violent, experts say

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: The U.S.- and Israeli-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation accused Hamas of killing at least five of its Palestinian employees on Wednesday, as almost 40 other Palestinians were killed near the foundation’s aid sites in the Gaza Strip
title: U.S.-backed aid group says Hamas killed five of its Palestinian workers in Gaza

author: The Associated Press
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark. — Seven Arkansas families filed a lawsuit Wednesday challenging an upcoming state requirement that public school classrooms have posted copies of the Ten Commandments, saying the new law will violate their constitutional rights
title: Families file suit challenging Arkansas law that requires Ten Commandments be posted in classrooms

author: The Associated Press
description: Iran and the United States will hold a sixth round of negotiations over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program this Sunday in Oman, the sultanate's foreign minister said Thursday, as regional tensions have spiked in recent days.
title: Oman foreign minister says there will be sixth round of negotiations between Iran and U.S. on Sunday

author: Reuters
description: North Korea appears to have stopped loudspeakers near the border targeting South Korea, South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said Thursday.
title: North Korea appears to follow the South in suspending loudspeaker broadcasts

author: Gordon Lubold
description: Israel is considering taking military action against Iran — most likely without U.S. support — in the coming days, even as President Donald Trump is in advanced discussions with Tehran about a diplomatic deal to curtail its nuclear program, according to five people with knowledge of the situation
title: Israel considering military strike on Iran, sources say

author: Andrew Greif
description: The Indiana Pacers didn't need one of their signature, improbable comebacks to win Game 3 of the NBA Finals.
title: Pacers grab 2-1 series lead in NBA Finals by outplaying Thunder late

author: The Associated Press
description: A Colorado funeral homeowner who pleaded guilty to leaving a woman’s corpse in the back of a hearse for over a year and improperly stashing the cremated remains of at least 30 people has been sentenced to 18 months in prison, the Denver District Attorney’s Office announced.
title: Colorado funeral home owner who left corpse in hearse for over a year sentenced to 18 months

author: Phil Helsel
description: Attorneys for Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was arrested by the government and sent to an El Salvador prison in error and then returned to the U.S., argue in a court filing Wednesday that he should be freed from jail pending criminal trial.
title: Attorneys for Kilmar Abrego Garcia argue he isn't a flight risk and should be released

author: Liz Calvario, TODAY
description: Ananda Lewis, a former MTV VJ, has died at the age of 52
title: MTV's Ananda Lewis Dies at 52

author: Gordon Lubold
description: Uniformed soldiers cheered and booed along with political statements, something typically frowned upon and potentially a violation of military regulations.
title: Trump speech prompts new questions, concerns about politicization of military

author: Frank Thorp V
description: Sen. Rand Paul, R-Ky., said he was "uninvited" to an annual White House picnic typically attended by members of Congress and their families, framing the move to reporters on Wednesday as retribution for his opposition to key components of President Donald Trump's agenda.“They’re afraid of what I’m saying, so they think they’re going to punish me, I can’t go to the picnic, as if somehow that’s going to make me more conciliatory,” Paul said.
title: 'Incredibly petty': Sen. Rand Paul says he was 'uninvited' to White House picnic over breaks with Trump

author: Chloe Melas
description: It wasn’t exactly the verdict that Harvey Weinstein accuser Kaja Sokola had hoped for, but it was the verdict she said women determined to fight against sexual predators needed.
title: Kaja Sokola, a Weinstein accuser, applauds his conviction
